titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Brooklyn Historical Society mixed manuscript collection 1974.037
titlestmt.author: Nicholas Pavlik
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection was originally processed and described as part of the project, "Uncovering the Secrets of Brooklyn's 19th Century Past: Creation to Consolidation," funded by the Council on Library and Information Resources, with additional support from The Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2025-10-22 19:41:09 +0000.
profiledesc.langusage: Description is written in: English, Latin script.

change.item: Updated by Mary Mann to reflect incorporation of additional materials
Revised by Amy Lau, Archivist, to remediate oppressive language from abstract note.

did.unittitle: Brooklyn Historical Society mixed manuscript collection

physdesc.extent: in one manuscript box, one flat box and one flat file folder.

did.abstract: Handwritten documents of various provenance that were artificially assembled by librarians at the Long Island Historical Society (now the Center for Brooklyn History). Documents primarily concern Kings, Queens, and Suffolk Counties in New York State. Most items are legal documents, such as court records, deeds, and bonds, but there are also government documents, military documents, letters and more.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: As a composite collection the source and date of acquisition for many of the materials is unknown. When known, the provenance is noted at the item level. The collection was first formally accessioned in 1974.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The collection is arranged in chronological order.

phystech.head: Physical Characteristics and Technical Requirements
phystech.p: If surrogates exist, they should be used in place of the originals whenever possible.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); Brooklyn Historical Society Mixed manuscript collection, 1974.037, Box and Folder number; Center for Brooklyn History, Brooklyn Public Library.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: This collection was processed to the item level.

Oppressive descriptive language was remediated from the abstract note in this finding aid as part of an anti-racist descriptive language audit performed in January 2021. Folder titles were retained to maintain record of descriptive language of collection creators.

The collection was reprocessed by Dee Bowers in 2025. At that time, the collection's arrangement was changed from alphabetical to chronological, description was enhanced where possible, oversize documents were flattened and rehoused, and certain items were removed to other more appropriate collections: a Red Cross paper "flag" to the Brooklyn ephemera collection (BCMS.0007) and documents from the Order of the Eastern Star to the Fraternal organizations of Brooklyn collection (ARC.147). Provenance documentation filed with collection items was removed to the collection's accession folder.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection contains mostly handwritten materials dating from 1626 to 1917. The collection was compiled by library staff at the Long Island Historical Society (now the Center for Brooklyn History). Documents primarily concern Kings, Queens, and Suffolk Counties in New York State, as well as the states of Massachusetts and Rhode Island. The majority of the items document the business dealings of individuals, from indentures to deeds to letters of recommendation. Additional materials include election records, military documents, family papers, and one enslaved person's bill of sale. Specific individuals and families represented in the documents include Robert Fulton, the Pettet family, Samuel Spragg, and the Young family, among others. Notable items include a court release endorsed by Aaron Burr, a document signed by John Adams, and letters signed by Frederick Douglass. Documents of Kings County representatives of the Continental Congress, as well as a 19th century copy of a 1626 document in Dutch referencing the Dutch purchase of the island of Manhattan from Native Americans, are also included.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: The materials in this collection are in the public domain. While many items at the Center for Brooklyn History are unrestricted, we do not own reproduction rights to all materials. Be aware of the several kinds of rights that might apply: copyright, licensing and trademarks. The researcher assumes all responsibility for copyright questions.

did.unittitle: Letter regarding the purchase of Manhattan

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: A photograph and transcription of the original document, which is held at the Hague.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: This photograph and transcription were made at the request of James Grant Wilson for the New York Genealogical and Biographical Society and presented to the Long Island Historical Society by Daniel Van Pelt in 1889.

did.unittitle: Suffolk County court records

phystech.head: Physical Characteristics and Technical Requirements
phystech.p: The original documents are fragile and researchers should use the provided photocopies when possible.

did.unittitle: Last will and testimony in County Court of N. London
Petitions and accompanying documents of the Apalachian and Timuquan Indians of Florida

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Gift of J. Carson Brevoort, received by him from Buckingham Smith in 1860.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Inscription notes that the documents are "in the Spanish and in the Apalachian and Timuquan (ancient languages of Florida)."

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: The documents were bound together between two covers. As the back cover was blank, deteriorating, and causing damage, the archivist discarded it.

did.unittitle: Westerly, RI town meeting notes
Declaration of belief in the sacrament and against adoration of saints, multiple signatures

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Note on verso of document states "Rec[eive]d from Mrs. J.H. Field, 412 Henry St. by Rev. N.P. Pierce of B[roo]klyn who gave it to [Long Island Historical] Society - was attained from Kingston, Ulster Co., NY where the Fields family resided." The names on the document seem to have been residents of Ulster County.

phystech.head: Physical Characteristics and Technical Requirements
phystech.p: The original document is fragile. Researchers should use the photostat copy whenever possible.

acqinfo.p: Gift of Miss Charlotte F. Jackson and Mr. A. Baldwin, 1915.

Records of Suffolk County court verdicts (William Smith, John Conklin)

Indenture for land sold to Richard Bryan in Cornwall, England

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Illuminated manuscript booklet in Latin.

did.unittitle: Decree appointing Richard Waterman to Providence, RI Justice of the Peace
Power of attorney notice of mariner Samuel Spragg
Royal order of leave for Daniel Hanton to appeal to the King in Council

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: By John Gardner, Governor of the English colony of Rhode Island.

did.unittitle: Kings County nominations for the Provincial Congress
Proofs of Tory allegiance for the protection of Richard Hudson of Suffolk County

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Presented through John M. Carrington, April 1866. Found under the hearthstone of a house in Cutchogue, Suffolk County, property of William M. Betts and torn down in 1866.

did.unittitle: Samuel and Silas Pettet documents of payment and safe passage
Pardon for treason issued by George III for Israel Howell of Suffolk County
List of Brooklyn estates exempted from newly raised tax

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Lists estates owned by the Rapelje, Livingston, Boerum, Suydam, and Vandervoort families, among others.

did.unittitle: Blank bond issued by quartermaster general Timothy Pickering

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: The name "Wm. A. Robbins" is noted on this document, and he may have been its source. Robbins was a genealogist, and many of his papers are held at CBH.

did.unittitle: An Act to Preserve the Freedom and Indpendence of this State [New York]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Printed by Samuel Loudon.

Labor contract for building of Southold Harbour wharf
Agreement to raise the salary of Rev. Martinus Schoonmaker (in Dutch)
An act to protect the contents of vessels wrecked at sea [New York State]
Appointment of John Bergen to assist shipwrecks
Letter from representatives of Queens County upholding Kings County congress nomination

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Gift of Miss Kate W. Strong, 1939.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Signed by Francis Lewis, Jr. and six others in Jamaica and addressed to the electors of Suffolk County.

did.unittitle: Letter of recommendation for Mr. Sands for Senator

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Addressed to the supervisors of the town of Brookhaven, Suffolk County, and signed by Charles Doughty and two others.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Photostat copy. Signed by Samuel Jones and Whitehead Cornwell.

did.unittitle: Benajah Strong sale of enslaved man James to Thomas Tredwell

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Strong is of Islip and Tredwell is of Huntington, both in Suffolk County.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents

did.unittitle: Lynde, Charles W. deed to Mitchell, Clarence G. in Brooklyn

Indenture for lumber business for Charles L. Snow in New York City
159th Regiment Volunteers

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Gift of Mabel L. Rees. The item was presented to her father Isaac L. Rose in honor of his Civil War service.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: Rose's rifle and bayonet is held by CBH with the object ID number M1986.250.

did.unittitle: Copy of General Order No. 10, distributed by Admiral Farragut to the captains under his command
List of laws affecting altering streets, avenues, etc, in the City of Brooklyn

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: "List of laws from 1867, affecting altering streets, avenues etc., in City of Brooklyn, in continuation of Schedule K (which is down to and including 1866) on page 72 in Dikeman's Compendium. Copied from book compiled by Jacob I. Bergen, Esq."

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: These handwritten pages were originally in a leatherbound notebook with a large blank section. The spine had fallen apart and the leather was deteriorating and causing damage. The inscription on the front cover, hardly legible, is reproduced word-for-word on a typed inset at the front of the volume. The archivist removed the pages with writing and discarded the blank pages and covers.

did.unittitle: Brooklyn Fire Brick and Clay Retort Works receipt

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: "Bought of Edward D. White, surviving partner of the late firm of J.K. Brick & Co., Brooklyn Fire Brick and Clay Retort Works, Van Dyke Street." Made out to Northern Liberties Gas Light Co.

did.unittitle: Receipt of goods for James Keenan from James Rorke and Co.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The company sells "a complete assortment of china, glass, earthenware, cutlery and plated ware, kerosene lamps etc." and is located at 233 Fulton Avenue, between Navy and Raymond Streets. The receipt is for table goods such as saucers, dishes, plates, pitchers, and so forth.

did.unittitle: Kings County notarized statements of pay
United States treasury bonds

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: "Act of March 3rd 1863...Fifteen million five hundred thousand dollars have been deposited with the Treasurer of the United States, payable in gold at his office, to Drexel, Morgan & Co. Morton, Bliss & Co. Jay Cooke & Co. or their order...Washington, September 9th 1873."

"May 1st 1871...Funded loan of 1881...Fifteen million five hundred dollars. This bond is issued in accordance with...an act of Congress...to authorize the refunding of the national debt, approved July 14 1870."

did.unittitle: Indenture for 100 Pierrepont Street

Home insurance purchased by Sarah Milburn for 177 Hoyt Street

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: For property at Madison Street and Sumner Avenue (now Marcus Garvey Boulevard) in Bedford-Stuyvesant, Brooklyn.

did.unittitle: Kings County surrogate court ruling for Jane Anne and Charles C. Pinckney
Payroll documentation for judiciary, sheriff and city courts in New York City
Letters from Frederick Douglass to H.M. Smith regarding a trip to Brooklyn

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Howard M. Smith was president of the Union League Club of Brooklyn. He invited Frederick Douglass to the club's annual dinner in commemoration of Lincoln's birthday.

did.unittitle: City of Brooklyn tax receipts for School District 6
Document describing 1628-1769 indentures and William Buery recommendation letter

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Accompanied by note: "found inserted in Vol. II of William Hutchinson's The History of the County of Cumberland...1794." The notes on the indentures relate to this part of Pennsylvania. The recommendation letter is from the Governor of Pennsylvania.

did.unittitle: Drawing and description of Samuel A. Willoughby
Anderfuhren, Albert last will and testimony
New York Dock Railway annual report and correspondence to Interstate Commerce Commission

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: One bound annual report (1914) and related correspondence (1914-1925).

did.unittitle: Broadsheets printed with Governor Charles S. Whitman's proclamation regarding a state military census

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: 3 copies.
